block_comment: This block of code is utilized to assign specific inputs to corresponding output signals in a memory interface system. First, the system clock is enabled using the "assign clk_en = 1" statement. Following that, four memory command signals are assigned from input "m_cmd". The statement "assign zs_addr = m_addr" assigns the memory address input to the appropriate output. The clock enable output is then set to the previous assigned clk_en. The data bus zs_dq is determined by the oe (output enable) condition, sending the m_data when it is set and in other cases it sends high impedance state. Then, data mask m_dqm and bank address m_bank are assigned to zs\_dqm and zs\_ba respectively.
